intro: Godetia purpurea var. arnottii, commonly known as the Arnott's godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
